sect1.title: About PMB
sect1.para: PMB is a completely free ILS (Integrated Library management System). The domain of software for libraries is almost exclusively occupied by proprietary products. We are some librarians, users and developers deploring this state of affairs.
PMB is based on web technology. This is what we sometimes call a 'web-app'. PMB requires an HTTP server (such as Apache, but this is not an obligation), the MySQL database and the PHP language.
The main functions of PMB are :

listitem.para: The ability to import full bibliographic records
A user-friendly OPAC integrating a browser
Loans management with a module designed to serve even the very small establishments
Simple administration procedures that can be handled easily even by the library staff...

sect1.para: More details can be found at www.sigb.net where you will also find an online demo version, the PMB users Web page, and the latest versions of the Installation Guide, the User Guide, and the Administrator Guide.

sect1.title: Where to find information about PMB
sect1.para: Via the users' mailing lists : pmb.user@sigb.net (free subscription, just send an email subject SUBSCRIBE to pmb.user_request@sigb.net)
Via the mailing lists for translators, developers, for Unicode support (non European alphabets). For more information on these lists, go to www.sigb.net
This documentation is viewable online at www.sigb.net/doc, the HTML version may be downloaded freely, it can be integrated within PMB to become a contextual help.

sect1.title: CVS
sect1.para: CVS stands for Concurrent Versions System. It is a tool for programmers for the management of source code updates.
PMB uses a CVS. The CVS is accessible to developers. Do not hesitate to contact us if you wish to help with the development of PMB or to participate in the write-up of the documentation.
For more information, contact the developers of PMB.
